decision_conditions:
<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The design and siting of the proposed development, would be an undesirable addition to the dwelling, removing a key architectural feature whilst also further unbalancing the symmetry and uniformity&nbsp;of the terrace row. The development fails to respect the character and appearance of the dwelling, built form of the terrace row and wider area.&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;"><br></span></div><ul><li><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="font-size: 10.5pt;">Paragraph 126 of the&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li>Policy D4 of the
London Plan (March 2021)</li><li>Policy
CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li>The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
description: Construction of a single storey front infill extension to facilitate a front porch and change of front façade from bricks to render finish
